fold:
(:action fold_lengthwise
    :parameters (?t - towel ?p - person)
    :precondition (and (at ?t ?p) (clean ?t))
    :effect (folded_lengthwise ?t)
)

(:action fold_half
    :parameters (?t - towel ?p - person)
    :precondition (and (at ?t ?p) (folded_lengthwise ?t))
    :effect (folded_half ?t)
)

(:action fold_half_again
    :parameters (?t - towel ?p - person)
    :precondition (and (at ?t ?p) (folded_half ?t))
    :effect (folded_half_again ?t)
)
unfold:
(:action unfold_and_hang
    :parameters (?t - towel ?r - rack ?c - closet ?p - person)
    :precondition (and (stored ?t ?c) (at ?c ?p) (at ?r ?p))
    :effect (and (hung ?t ?r) (not (stored ?t ?c)))
)
```

Explanation:
- `fold_lengthwise`: This action represents folding the towel in thirds lengthwise.
- `fold_half`: This action represents folding the towel in half after it has been folded lengthwise.
- `fold_half_again`: This action represents folding the towel in half again after the first half fold.
- `store_in_closet`: This action represents storing the folded towel in the linen closet.
- `unfold_and_hang`: This action represents unfolding the final fold and hanging the towel on the towel rack.

Each action has parameters (objects involved), preconditions (conditions that must be true before the action), and effects (outcomes of the action).
